image.altText: A bald man in a black suit and white button down shirt without a tie looks serious.

props.synopsis: Newly-elected MLA Thomas Emerson caused some furore when he turned up to day one of the ACT's Legislative Assembly sans-tie, with the speaker warning of a "dramatic decline" of dress standards. But is it time to get with the times, and ditch the tie altogether?

title.children: A politician's refusal to wear a tie has prompted the question of their relevance

image.altText: A public bus with a wrap on the back that reads "MyWay+".

props.synopsis: Speaking to Stateline, ACT Chief Minister Andrew Barr concedes the government should have waited several more days before rolling out a new public transport ticketing system that was plagued with problems as it went live.

title.children: ACT government concedes it should have postponed MyWay+ rollout

image.altText: A young girl gives the thumbs up while wearing a Parramatta Eels jersey.

props.synopsis: Rozalia Spadafora's mother was holding back tears but she did not mince her words when she spoke about Canberra Health Services following the coronial inquest into her daughter's untimely death.

title.children: What this five-year-old's death tells us about the state of the ACT health system

image.altText: Canberra Hospital taxi near emergency department

props.synopsis: New data shows the average time patients spent being treated in ACT emergency departments has improved in the past financial year, but Canberra Health Services still failed to meet all but one of its emergency wait-time targets.

title.children: Canberra has shortest emergency department stay in the country, but fails on other fronts

image.altText: A laptop computer sits open on a bed in a dark room showing an email account on screen.

props.synopsis: The Canberra woman, who cannot be named for legal reasons, was prepared to pay $20,000 for her parents to be killed and had paid $7,500 towards that goal.

title.children: Woman spared further jail time after hiring hit man to kill parents on dark web

image.altText: A post-impressionist painting of a crowded Australian beach.

props.synopsis: At first glance artists Ethel Carrick and Anne Dangar seem to have little in common besides gender and career choice, but a new exhibition at the National Gallery of Australia is inviting visitors to take a closer look.

title.children: Two 'important yet under-acknowledged' women artists celebrated in National Gallery of Australia exhibition

image.altText: A building sign that reads 'ACT Civil and Administrative Tribunal'.

props.synopsis: The ACT Civil and Administrative Tribunal found the ACT government discriminated against the public servant over her criminal history.

title.children: ACT government ordered to pay former employee $265k after finding she was discriminated against

image.altText: Georgie sits on a rowing machine, rowing in her workout gear.

props.synopsis: This year's Paris Games was the worst performance from the Australian rowing team at the Olympics in decades, highlighting gaps in the sport's accessibility — but a new initiative set up in Canberra is hoping to change that.

title.children: Some sports aren't accessible to public school students. This program is trying to change that

image.altText: A woman washes green leaves in a bucket

props.synopsis: Kratom has been used for centuries as a traditional medicine in South-East Asia, but as its popularity has soared in the United States, so too has the controversy around it.

title.children: Traditional Thai medicine hailed as wonder drug in US comes with risks

image.altText: An Islamist militant in camouflage gear and wielding an assault gun stands in the middle of a Syrian street.

props.synopsis: Islamist fighters were approaching a major Syrian city on Friday as part of a rapid offensive, while Kurdish fighters began seizing territory in the country's east.

title.children: Rebels reach Homs as UN says 370,000 people displaced by Syrian war

image.altText: Mitchell Starc holds the ball up towards the crowd as he leaves the field

props.synopsis: Nobody can control the pink ball like Mitchell Starc, but his career-best performance on day one in Adelaide was more than just speed and swing — and has put Australia in a dominant position.

title.children: Starc's pink ball mastery hands Australia a chance to control its destiny

image.altText: A lit up sign for TikTok on the side of a building in the US.

props.synopsis: The social media giant has been pushing back on the laws, signed by President Joe Biden earlier this year.

title.children: Court upholds US law forcing sale or ban of Tiktok

image.altText: A generic image of compounded semaglutide in a small bottle, with a pharmacy label and red liquid, next to a syringe.

props.synopsis: Weight-loss drugs like Ozempic are transforming the fight against obesity, but they are forcing us to face crucial questions about equity and whether they should be prescribed to children.

title.children: Doctors weigh societal costs of using drugs to treat obesity crisis

image.altText: elon musk stands at a lectern with his mouth open and fists in the air

props.synopsis: As Donald Trump prepares to return to the White House, Elon Musk and Tesla look likely to benefit from influential ties to both the US president and the Chinese government.

title.children: Elon Musk set to be go-between between Trump and China

image.altText: A woman with curly hair and a yellow and black check top listens to music through red headphones in a restaurant

props.synopsis: I'm in the same agony of embarrassment and attempted recovery as most of my social media-addicted generation, as my Spotify Wrapped for the year has dropped — and I don't know who the hell they are talking about.

title.children: Between Goblincore and Taylor Swift, I'm baffled by my Spotify Wrapped

image.altText: A rocket boosting above the ocean.

props.synopsis: The sixth test flight by Elon Musk's space company didn't go exactly to plan, but commentators say there are lessons to be learnt from the work of Pilbara salvage crews.

title.children: Remnants of Musk's SpaceX rocket salvaged off WA's Ningaloo coast

image.altText: A man (Bill Chalker) sits at a desk examining the RAAF's ufo files

props.synopsis: Bill Chalker was one of the first civilians to access Australia's secret UFO files — but when the day finally came, there was one problem. They hadn't been declassified.

title.children: UFOs over Australia and the military's 'very real-world' concerns

image.altText: A supermarket shelf has limited stock on it and lots of empty space.

props.synopsis: Woolworths has won its bid against the United Workers Union, with the Fair Work Commission finding the union has been unfairly negotiating with the supermarket giant.

title.children: Fair Work Commission finds union unfairly negotiating with Woolworths

image.altText: Richard Nixon and Gerald Ford chat in the Oval Office as they go over papers

props.synopsis: Joe Biden has reneged on his promise not to pardon his son over federal gun felonies and tax crimes. His eleventh-hour decision isn't the first controversial use of presidential clemency powers in US history.

title.children: Biden's pardon reflects controversy that dogs US presidential clemency

image.altText: An andromorphic chimpanzee is surrounded by paparazzi

props.synopsis: The 2025 AACTA award nominations contain record breakers in both the film and television categories.

title.children: Boy Swallows Universe and Robbie Williams biopic lead 2025 AACTAs

image.altText: Maggie Tabberer smiles at a red carpet event.

props.synopsis: Maggie Tabberer's career included everything from modelling work to running a fashion label, hosting a TV show and gracing front pages of magazines until her 80s, making her a household name.

title.children: Gold Logies and criminally good photo shoots: These were Maggie Tabberer's best moments

image.altText: Nic

props.synopsis: The incidence of strokes in young people is rising globally, but finding a village can be a challenge, writes survivor Nicola Bray.

title.children: Nicola's brain 'exploded' just before her 18th birthday

image.altText: A man in a grey suit poses with his chin in his hand

props.synopsis: The Constitutional Court's unprecedented decision came after Romania's president declassified intelligence that alleged Russia ran a coordinated social media campaign to promote a far-right outsider.

title.children: Romanian court annuls election votes after Russian interference fears

image.altText: Sydney to Hobart race lead up

props.synopsis: A man believed to be in his 50s who was found with severe chest injuries is dead following the incident at Darling Point.

title.children: Man dies after two boats collide on Sydney Harbour

image.altText: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol delivers a speech at a lectern

props.synopsis: South Korea's National Assembly Speaker Woo Won-shik tells parliament that he and other politicians will fight to prevent martial law if President Yoon Suk Yeol declares it again.

title.children: South Korea's speaker vows no repeat of martial law measure

image.altText: An AFP image showing with Anthony Sitar is expected to look like now

props.synopsis: The extradition of Easey street accused Perry Kouroumblis has highlighted other Australians on Interpol's "red notice" list, including Anthony Sitar.

title.children: He's one of Australia's most wanted men and on Interpol's radar

image.altText: Man with hiking gear smiles and points back/upwards at a mountain full of snow with ski tracks

props.synopsis: The men, from the US and Canada, had been missing for five days and are believed to have died in a fall on Aoraki.

title.children: Three climbers believed dead on New Zealand's highest peak

image.altText: A cold glass of iced long black sits on a white bench top.

props.synopsis: With summer upon us and the potential for more extreme heatwaves, what's the best way to stay hydrated? And do cold drinks really cool us down?

title.children: Will a cup of tea quench your thirst or make you more dehydrated?

image.altText: A man standing in the burnt remains of a house

props.synopsis: A disability pensioner left homeless by an e-scooter fire issues a desperate warning, as data reveals lithium-ion batteries have been responsible for hundreds of blazes across Queensland.

title.children: Pensioner who lost home in e-scooter fire says batteries a 'ticking time bomb'

image.altText: A crowd of people carrying umbrellas and shopping bags walk along a street on a rainy day.

props.synopsis: After months of saving, households are starting to feel confident enough to spend. Some economists say it is an early indication the stage 3 tax cuts are finally having an impact.

title.children: Households are starting to spend again after holding back for months

image.altText: A polar bear walking on ice next to water.

props.synopsis: A man who "leapt onto" a polar bear to protect his wife from the attacking animal is expected to recover from serious injuries he sustained, police say.

title.children: Canadian man leaps onto polar bear to defend wife

image.altText: Donald Trump wears a red cap whilst chatting to Elon Musk

props.synopsis: The group, which was named RBG PAC, spent nearly all of the donated money on advertising — ads that claimed RGB was of the same opinion as Donald Trump on the issue of abortion.

title.children: Elon Musk sole-funded Ruth Bader Ginsburg PAC during US elections

props.synopsis: The International Criminal Court has issued arrest warrants for the leaders of Israel and Hamas. But international justice works differently to other forms of justice — it requires countries opting in. Will they ever have their day in court?

title.children: If You're Listening explores the courts and war crimes allegations

image.altText: A red deer stares straight at the camera

props.synopsis: Meat harvested from culling programs of boar, goat, venison and even wallaby could be a fine dining solution to a waste of protein, but a successful industry could be in danger of undermining itself if populations fall.

title.children: Baking invasive species in pies helps reduce numbers, but ecologists have reservations

image.altText: Gout Gout gives the thumbs up after a 100m race at the Australian All School Championships.

props.synopsis: At just 16, Gout Gout underlines his potential with more outstanding performances at the Australian All Schools Championships in Brisbane on Friday.

title.children: Teenage sprint star Gout Gout edges closer to breaking 10-second barrier for 100m
